paragraph: CHAPTER 30. A NEW TURN OF THE TIDE.
tokens: new turn tide

paragraph: The three weeks of Christmas holiday darted past only too rapidly for most of the boys at Saint Dominic's.  Holidays have a miserable knack of sliding along.  The first few days seem delightfully long.  Then, after the first week, the middle all of a sudden becomes painfully near.  And the middle once passed, they simply tear, and bolt, and rush pitilessly on to the end, when, lo and behold! your time is up before you well knew it had begun.
tokens: week holiday dart most boy holiday have miserable knack slide first few day seem long first week middle become near middle pass tear bolt rush end behold time know begin

paragraph: So it happened with most of the boys.  With one or two, however, the holiday dragged heavily, and one of these was Master Thomas Senior. This forlorn youth, no longer now rollicking Tom of the Fifth, but the meek and mild, and withal sulky, hopeful of the Reverend Thomas Senior, D.D., of Saint Dominic's, watched the last of his chums go off with anything but glee.  He was doomed to three weeks' kicking of his heels in the empty halls and playgrounds of Saint Dominic's, with nothing to do and no one to do it with.  For the boy's mother was ill, which kept the whole family at home, and Tom's baby brother, vivacious youth as he was, was hardly of a companionable age yet.
tokens: happen most boy holiday drag forlorn youth rollick fifth meek mild sulky hopeful watch last chum go glee doom week kick heel empty hall playground do do boy mother ill keep whole family home baby brother vivacious youth companionable age

paragraph: As to the Doctor (Tom, by the way, even in the bosom of his family, always thought and talked of his father as the "Doctor")--as for the Doctor, well, Tom was inclined to shirk the risk of more _tete-a-tetes_ than he could possibly help with so formidable a personage, even though he _was_ his own parent.
tokens: way bosom family think talk father inclined shirk risk more _tete tetes_ help formidable personage own parent

paragraph: But try all he could, Tom was let in for it once, when he found himself face to face one day at dinner with the Doctor, and no third person to help him out.
tokens: try let find face face day dinner third person help

paragraph: The occasion was quite early in the holidays, and was indeed about the first opportunity the father had had since breaking-up for anything like a conversation with his affable son.
tokens: occasion holiday first opportunity father have break conversation affable son

paragraph: Tom's conversational powers were never very brilliant, and when in the subduing presence of his father they always dwindled down to nothing. It was, therefore, somewhat difficult, under the circumstances, to keep the talk going, but the Doctor did his best.  Tom answered in monosyllables, and looked fearfully sheepish, and found his best policy was always to keep his mouth full, and so have the excuse of good manners on his side for his silence.
tokens: conversational power brilliant subdue presence father dwindle difficult circumstance keep talk go do good answer monosyllable look sheepish find good policy keep mouth full have excuse good manners side silence

paragraph: "Tom," said the Doctor, presently, steering round to a subject which it had been for some time in his mind to question his son about, "that was an extraordinary demonstration on prize-day, when Greenfield senior came up to get his scholarship."
tokens: say steering subject time mind question son extraordinary demonstration prize day senior come get scholarship

paragraph: "It wasn't me," said Tom, colouring up.
tokens: say colour

paragraph: "My dear boy, I never supposed it was," said the Doctor, laughing.  "But it surprised me very much, as well as pained me."
tokens: dear boy suppose say laugh surprise pain

paragraph: "I couldn't help it," again said Tom.
tokens: help say

paragraph: "Of course you couldn't, Tom.  But I am sorry to find Greenfield is so unpopular in the school."
tokens: course sorry find unpopular school

paragraph: The Doctor did not care to put a direct question to Tom on the matter that was perplexing him.  He hoped to draw him out by more indirect means.  But he was mistaken if he ever expected it, for Tom, with the perversity of a fellow who _will_ take everything that is said as a rebuke to himself, showed no inclination to follow the lead.  The Doctor had, therefore, to ask outright.
tokens: care put direct question matter perplex hope draw indirect means mistaken expect perversity fellow take say rebuke show inclination follow lead ask

paragraph: "What dreadful crime has he committed, Tom, to be treated so severely?"
tokens: dreadful crime commit treat

paragraph: "I don't want to treat him severely," said Tom.  "Tom," said the Doctor, half angrily, "you are very foolish.  I was not referring to you particularly, but to the whole school."
tokens: want treat say say half foolish refer whole school

paragraph: Tom sulked at this more than ever.  _He_ wasn't going to be called foolish.  The Doctor, however, tried once more.
tokens: sulk more go call foolish try

paragraph: "What has he done to offend you all?  Has he missed a catch at cricket, or a kick at football?  I hope, whatever it is--"
tokens: do offend miss catch cricket kick football hope

paragraph: "It isn't me!" once more growled Tom, heartily wishing the meal was over.
tokens: growl wish meal

paragraph: The Doctor gave it up as a bad job.  There was no use trying to get a rise out of Tom.  If that ingenuous youth had been trying to shield his Form, he could not have done it better.  As it was, he was only stupidly trying to shield himself, and letting his dread of his "Doctor" father get the better of his common sense and good manners.
tokens: give bad job be use try get rise ingenuous youth try shield form do good try shield let dread father get good common sense good manners

paragraph: Luckily for Tom, a friend wrote to invite him to spend the last week of the holidays in London, an invitation which that youth, as well as his parent for him, thankfully accepted.  Indeed, during the holidays Mrs Senior became so ill that the poor Doctor had no thoughts to spare for anybody or anything but her and her hope of recovery.  He watched her night and day through all the vicissitudes of her fever, and when at last the crisis was over, and the doctors said she would recover, they said also that unless Dr Senior wanted to have an illness himself he must go away and get perfect rest and change for a week or two at the very least.
tokens: friend write invite spend last week holiday invitation youth parent accept holiday become ill poor have thought spare hope recovery watch night day vicissitude fever last crisis doctor say recover say want have illness go get perfect rest change week very least

paragraph: The consequence of all this was that Saint Dominic's had to reassemble after the Christmas holidays without the Doctor.
tokens: consequence have reassemble holiday

paragraph: To some of the boys this was sorrowful news; others regarded the circumstance with indifference, while one section there was who received the intelligence with positive joy.
tokens: boy sorrowful news other regard circumstance indifference section receive intelligence positive joy

paragraph: Strange that that section should contain in it two such opposites as Loman of the Sixth and Bramble of the Fourth Junior.
tokens: strange section contain such opposite sixth fourth

paragraph: Loman, despite his "run of luck," had spent an uneasy holiday.  He had been in constant terror of seeing Cripps every time he ventured outside his house; and he had been in still more terror of Cripps calling up at Saint Dominic's and telling the Doctor all about him directly after the holidays.  For now Loman's time was up.  Though he had in one way and another paid off all his debt to the landlord of the Cockchafer but eight pounds, still he knew Cripps could make himself quite as unpleasant about eight pounds as about thirty pounds, and probably would.
tokens: run luck spend uneasy holiday constant terror see time venture house more terror call tell holiday time have way pay debt landlord pound know make unpleasant pound pound

paragraph: But as long as the Doctor was away it didn't matter so much.  And, besides, the examination for the exhibition would of course be postponed, which meant so much longer time for preparation--which meant so much better chance for Loman of winning it.  For, when he tried, he could work hard and effectively.
tokens: matter examination exhibition course postpone mean long time preparation mean good chance win try work

paragraph: So Loman was very glad to hear the Doctor was away ill.  So was Bramble!
tokens: glad hear ill

paragraph: That youth (who, by the way, had during the holidays quite recovered from the sobering effect of his grandmother's visit to the school) was always on a look-out for escaping the eye of the constituted authorities.  He hardly ever saw the Doctor from one month's end to another; but somehow, to know he was away--to know any one was away who ought to be there to look after him--was a glorious opportunity!  He launched at once into a series of revolutionary exploits on the strength of it.  He organised mutinies ten times a day, and had all the specifications drawn up for blowing up Saint Dominic's with paraffin oil.  There was nothing, in short, Bramble would not venture while the Doctor was away; and there is no knowing how far he might have carried his bloodthirsty conspiracies into effect had not Mr Rastle caught him one day with a saw, sawing the legs off the writing-master's stool, and given him such a chastisement, bodily and mental, as induced him for a brief season to retire from public life, and devote all his spare time to copying out an imposition.
tokens: youth way have holiday recover sobering effect grandmother visit school look escape eye constitute authority see month end know know one look glorious opportunity launch series revolutionary exploit strength organised mutiny time day have specification draw blow paraffin oil be short venture be know carry bloodthirsty conspiracy effect catch day saw saw leg writing master stool give chastisement bodily mental induce brief season retire public life devote spare time copy imposition

paragraph: On the first morning after reassembling, Mr Jellicott, the master in charge of Saint Dominic's, summoned the Fourth, Fifth, and Sixth to meet him in the lecture-theatre, and there announced to them the reason of the head master's absence.
tokens: first morning reassemble master charge summon fourth fifth meet lecture theatre announce reason head master absence

paragraph: "In consequence of this," said Mr Jellicott, "the removes gained last term will not be put into force for a week or two, till the head master returns; but, meanwhile, Dr Senior is anxious that the work of the school should go on as usual.  We shall, therefore, resume studies to-morrow; and on Monday next the examination for the Waterston Exhibition will be held, as arranged.  The three boys--Loman, Greenfield senior, and Wraysford--entered for this will be excused ordinary lessons till after the examination."
tokens: consequence say remove gain last term put force week head master return anxious work school go usual resume study examination hold arrange boy senior enter excuse ordinary lesson examination

paragraph: Greenfield senior!  Then Oliver _was_ in for it after all!  The announcement amazed Wraysford as much as it did Loman and every one else.  It had never entered their minds that he would go in for it. Hadn't he got the Nightingale? and wasn't that enough for one half-year? And didn't every one know _how_ he had got it, and how could the fellow now have the assurance to put in for another examination?
tokens: senior announcement amaze much do one else enter mind go get enough half year one know get fellow have assurance put examination

paragraph: Oliver always had been a queer fellow, and this move struck every one as queerer than ever.
tokens: queer fellow move strike one queerer

paragraph: But to Wraysford and one or two others it occurred in a different light. If Oliver had really won the Nightingale in the manner every one suspected, he would hardly now boldly enter for another examination, in which he might possibly not succeed, and so prove those suspicions to be true.  For the subjects were almost exactly the same as those examined in for the Nightingale, and unless Oliver did as well here as he did there--and that was _remarkably_ well--it would be open for anybody to say, "Of course--he couldn't steal the paper this time, that's why!"
tokens: other occur different light win manner one suspect enter examination succeed prove suspicion true subject same examine open say course steal paper time

paragraph: Wraysford, as he thought over it, became more and more uneasy and ashamed of himself.  One moment he persuaded himself Oliver was a hypocrite, and the next that he was innocent.  "At any rate," said he to himself, "this examination will settle it."
tokens: think become uneasy ashamed moment persuade hypocrite next innocent rate say examination settle

paragraph: In due time the examination day came, and once more the three rivals heard their names called upon to come forward and occupy that memorable front desk in the Sixth Form room.
tokens: due time examination day come rival hear name call come occupy memorable front desk sixth room

paragraph: This time at any rate there had been no chance for any one to take an unfair advantage, for the Doctor's papers did not reach Saint Dominic's till the morning of the examination.  Indeed, Mr Jellicott was opening the envelope which contained them when the boys entered the room.
tokens: time rate be chance one take unfair advantage paper reach morning examination open envelope contain boy enter room

paragraph: Any one closely observing the three boys as they glanced each down his paper would once more have been struck by the strange contrast in their faces.  Oliver's, as his eyes glanced rapidly down the page, was composed and immovable; Wraysford's, as he looked first at his paper and then hurriedly at Oliver and Loman, was perplexed and troubled; Loman's was blank and pale and desponding.
tokens: one observe boy glance paper strike strange contrast face eye glance page compose immovable look paper perplex trouble blank pale despond

paragraph: But of the three, the happiest that morning was Wraysford--not that he was sure of success, not that his conscience was clear of all reproach, but because, as he sat there, working hard himself and hearing some one's pen on his left flying with familiar sound quickly over the paper, he felt at last absolutely sure that he had misjudged his friend, and equally resolved that, come what would of it, and humiliating as the confession would be, he would, before that day ended, be reconciled to Oliver Greenfield.  What mattered it to him, then, who won the exhibition?  Loman might win it for all _he_ cared, as long as he won back his friend.
tokens: happy morning sure success conscience clear reproach sit work hear pen left fly familiar sound paper feel last sure misjudg friend resolve come humiliate confession day end reconcile matter win exhibition win _he_ care win friend

paragraph: However, Loman at that moment did not look much like winning anything. If he had been in difficulties in the former examination, he was utterly stranded now.  He tried first one question, then another, but no inspiration seemed to come; and at last, after dashing off a few lines at random, he laid down his pen, and, burying his face in his hands, gave himself up to his own wretched thoughts.  He must see Cripps soon; he must go to him or Cripps would come up to Saint Dominic's, and then--
tokens: moment look win difficulty former examination strand try first question inspiration seem come last dash few line random lay pen bury face hand give own wretch thought see go come

paragraph: Well, Loman did not do much execution that morning, and was thankful when presently Mr Jellicott said, "Time will be up in five minutes, boys."
tokens: do much execution morning thankful say time minute boy

paragraph: The announcement was anything but welcome to the other two competitors, both of whom were writing, hammer and tongs, as though their lives depended on it.  Loman looked round at them and groaned as he looked. Why should they be doing so well and he be doing so ill?
tokens: announcement welcome other competitor write hammer tong life depend look groan look do do ill

paragraph: "Look at those two beggars!" said Callonby to Stansfield, in a whisper, pointing to Wraysford and Oliver.  "There's a neck-and-neck race for you!"
tokens: look beggar say whisper point be neck neck race

paragraph: So it was.  Now Oliver seemed to be getting over the ground quicker, and now Wraysford.  Now Wraysford lost a good second by looking up at the clock; now Greenfield made a bad shot with his pen at the inkpot, and had to dip again, which threw him back half a second at least.

paragraph: Unconscious of the interest and amusement they were exciting among the sporting section of the Sixth, they kept the pace up to the finish, and when at last Mr Jellicott said, "Cease writing and bring up your papers," both groaned simultaneously, as much as to say, "A second or two more would have done it."

paragraph: The examination was over, but the event of that memorable day was still to take place.
tokens: examination event memorable day take place

paragraph: Five minutes later Oliver, who had retired alone, as usual, to his study, there to announce to the anxious Stephen how he had fared in the examination, caught the sudden sound of an old familiar footstep outside his door, which sent the blood to his cheeks with strange emotion. Stephen heard it, and knew it too.
tokens: minute retire usual study announce anxious fare examination catch sudden sound old familiar footstep door send blood cheek strange emotion hear know

paragraph: "There's that beast Wraysford," he said, at the very instant that Wraysford, not waiting to knock, flung open the door and entered.
tokens: be beast say very instant wait knock flung open door enter

paragraph: There was no need for him to announce his errand.  It was written on his face as he advanced with outstretched hand to his old friend.
tokens: be need announce errand write face advance outstretched hand old friend

paragraph: "Noll, old man," was all he could say, as their eyes met, "the youngster's right--I _am_ a beast!"
tokens: old man say eye meet youngster right beast

paragraph: At the first word--the first friendly word spoken to him for months-- Oliver started to his feet like one electrified; and before the sentence was over his hand was tightly grasping the hand of his friend, and Stephen had disappeared from the scene.  It is no business of ours to pry into that happy study for the next quarter of an hour.  If we did the reader would very likely be disappointed, or perhaps wearied, or perhaps convinced that these two were as great fools in the manner of their making up as they had been in the manner of their falling out.
tokens: first word first friendly word speak month start foot electrify sentence hand grasp hand friend disappear scene business pry happy study next quarter hour do reader disappoint weary convinced great fool manner making manner falling

paragraph: Oh! the happiness of that precious quarter of an hour, when the veil that has divided two faithful friends is suddenly dashed aside, and they rush one to the other, calling themselves every imaginable bad name in the dictionary, insisting to the verge of quarrelling that it was all their fault, and no fault at all of the other, far too rapturous to talk ordinary common sense, and far too forgetful of everything to remember that they are saying the same thing over and over again every few minutes.
tokens: happiness precious quarter hour veil divide faithful friend dash rush other call imaginable bad name dictionary insist verge quarrelling fault fault other rapturous talk ordinary common sense forgetful remember say same thing few minute

paragraph: "The falling out of faithful friends"--as the old copybooks say in elegant Virgilian Latin--"renewing is of love."  And so it was with Oliver and Wraysford.
tokens: falling faithful friend old copybook say elegant virgilian renew love

paragraph: Why, they were twice the friends they were before!  Twice!  Fifty times! And they laughed and talked and made fools of themselves for a whole half-hour over the discovery, and might have done so for an hour, had not Stephen, who had patiently remained outside for a reasonable time, now returned to join in the celebration.
tokens: friend time laugh talk make fool whole half hour discovery do hour remain reasonable time return join celebration
